extendedInfo.description: Unleash your creativity no matter where you are, with Serious Paint, the most serious natural media content creation environment for Android!Serious Paint bends over backwards to make your Android device into a proper art workstation. Â The keys to Serious Paint's value are:	-- Natural media brushes that simulate proper bristles and blending, the way your workstation software does.	-- Innovative and intuitive workflow that allows you to perform common actions without breaking your flow to click on buttons.	-- Quietly brilliant ideas such as the Color Sweep, a configurable swatch of color that you can set up and then access with a simple gesture while drawing.

reviews.comment: It would be nice to be able to blend the paint (it would move more after it is laid down).  I would like more oily paint effects.
reviews.author: Mark Anderson

reviews.title: Excellent start
reviews.comment: Full points in the brush response. It\'s the third best I\'ve  experienced so far on my Samsung Note. (behind Autodesk Sketchbook and the short lived TVpaint beta)   Layer palette with the blend mode options is great. And I really like the symmetry tools implementation.  A couple of suggestions:  An option for each brush to reset to original default values. A view option to hide the bottom corner control icons until the centre puck is tapped (it\'s great that they duck out while drawing but little distracting)
reviews.author: Bob Roach

reviews.title: Good brushes and interesting effects
reviews.comment: This is an interesting app with many good features although it needs a bit of refining.   I buy apps  to support the developer, and future updates. I hope to see more updates in the near future.
reviews.author: Cheyenne Kolody

reviews.title: Great at first....
reviews.comment: But now, the paid version is broken. It won\'t open. It just apologizes for closing. That\'s a bummer. I really liked it.
reviews.author: Damian Mann

reviews.title: Excellent drawing and painting app -- layers + user interface = win
reviews.comment: I\'ve used EVERY drawing app on Android, in search of \'the one\'. And I suspect this might be it.   Layers are vital in a professional painting app. They\'re here, and they\'re excellent. Easy to use, easy to manipulate.  The user interface is gorgeous. Borrows a bit from Infinite Design, using flyouts. Easy, inconspicuous, ready for action.  The only thing that would make it better is faster control of sizing the brush. (And it might very well be there. Maybe I just need to discover the mechanism.)  Excellent!
reviews.author: Roy Blumenthal

reviews.title: The Best Painting App for Android
reviews.comment: Lovely brushes, really painterly with proper blending. First Android app I\'ve seen with layers etc that are really powerful and easy to use. The UI concept is cool, and more to the point it seems like it\'d be actually productive.
reviews.author: daren deli

reviews.title: Has Promise...
reviews.comment: This app offers some nice brushes and features, but the interface is very similar to my app, Infinite Painter, and needs some polish. Currently working with the developer on this issue.
reviews.author: Sean Brakefield

reviews.title: Amazingly powerful
reviews.comment: While initially daunting, the power and flexibility of this app become apparent as soon as you start to use it and invest some time to learn it. The vast array of brush configuration options helps you to deliver some amazing results for a paint program in your pocket. Highly recommended.
reviews.author: Steve Cusack

reviews.title: Rip off
reviews.comment: Ok guys. I hope Sean Brakefield (you know, the guy you stole the entire GUI concept from) takes this as a compliment. It\'s really quite embarrassing... However, that does not mean that you haven\'t done a great job, cause you have. The app is really responsive and the brushes look really good. Still, shame on you. I\'ll only give you a 2.
reviews.author: Lars Wallin

reviews.title: Ripped Off The App Infinite Painter
reviews.comment: This developer blatantly ripped off the app Infinite Painter by Sean Brakefield.  But Infinite Painter if you want a highly polished and professionally, and don\'t buy this ripoff unless you  want an unoriginal, uncreative, hack of an app and like supporting thieves.
reviews.author: Gordon Alf Shumway
